sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The interiour Christian, or, The interiour conformity which Christians ought to have with Jesus Christ divided into eight books, which contain most divine meditations, extracted out of the writings of a great servant of God of this age / translated out of the 12th edition in French. Chrestien interieur. English Bernières Louvigny, Monsieur de, (Jean), 1602-1659. A. L.
[26], 476 p.
[s.n.], Antwerp : 1684.
Translation of: Chrestien interieur. Translator's preface signed: A.L. Written by Jean de Bernières Louvigny. Cf. BM. Reproduction of original in British library.
=======
